resources.string: *Fields are mandatory and cannot be empty\n(ASCII commands must be of single character)
*All fields are mandatory\n**NOTE: Download the language in your device before proceeding.\nEx-If commands are given in English then English language must be avialable to be recognised by the app.

"** Say 'Forward' for forward movement
** Say 'Backward' for backward movement
**Say 'Right' to move right
**Say 'Left' to move left
**Say 'Stop' to stop the bot

"
Tap the mic to provide commands
**NOTE: Be careful at your voice essence during providing commands.

This app has two running modes(currently):

 1) Manual mode- It has a remote control (Up arrow - move forward, Down arrow - move backward, Right arrow - move right, Left arrow - move left)

It has a button to start or stop the bot. To bring the bot to ready mode , first press the start button then move to the arrows for respective movements. When u need to stop the bot press the stop button (formerly "start" button) 
.
2)Voice command mode - It has a voice listener mic and the commands can be provided by tapping on the mic. You can provide name to your bot for your local essence.

Remember: Be very careful about your voice essence during providing commands. For this reason your recorded voice is also shown in the app in order to check your voice essence. 
The language that you are going to use must be available(offline or online) in your device for proper language recognition. For ex- If you want to use language of Netherlands then its respective language must be available in your "Languages and input"

Connect your bluetooth module first by the app then provide the ASCII commands (case sensitive(present in your arduino code)) for respective activities(ASCII commands can be modified in respective modes(see the menus in various modes)), then operate the bot.

Note: In case the app fails to control the bot, you can control it via cloud of which options are given in the app. (Press the cloud button)
All the best
Tap below to start/stop the bot
